gst.data

Class DatasetList

  • java.lang.Object
    • gst.data.DatasetList

  • public class DatasetList
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton collection of all loaded datasets.
    Version:
    0.0.0.2 (12.10.2012)
    Author:
    Enrico Grunitz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<UnisensDataset> datasets
      list of datasets
      private static DatasetList instance
      instance of this class

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private DatasetList()
      Private Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close(int index)
      Closes the specified dataset and removes it from the list.
      UnisensDataset get(int index)
      Returns the dataset with the given index.
      static DatasetList getInstance()
      Returns the instance of this class' object.
      java.lang.String[] getNames()
      Returns an array of the dataset names.
      java.lang.String[] getNames(int index)
      Returns a String array with the (short) names of all DataControllers of the selected dataset.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this list contains no elements.
      int loadDataset()
      Opens a LoadDatasetDialog and loads the user specified dataset.
      void save(int index)
      Saves the specified dataset.
      int size()
      Returns the number of elements in this list.

      • getInstance

        public static DatasetList getInstance()
        Returns the instance of this class' object.
        Returns:
        the singleton instance

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of elements in this list.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in this list

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this list contains no elements.
        Returns:
        true if this list contains no elements

      • get

        public UnisensDataset get(int index)
        Returns the dataset with the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - index of dataset
        Returns:
        the requested dataset

      • getNames

        public java.lang.String[] getNames()
        Returns an array of the dataset names. The names are in the same order as the elements in this list.
        Returns:
        string array of dataset names

      • getNames

        public java.lang.String[] getNames(int index)
        Returns a String array with the (short) names of all DataControllers of the selected dataset.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the dataset to select
        Returns:
        array of DataController names

      • close

        public void close(int index)
        Closes the specified dataset and removes it from the list.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the dataset to close

      • save

        public void save(int index)
        Saves the specified dataset.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the dataset to save

      • loadDataset

        public int loadDataset()
        Opens a LoadDatasetDialog and loads the user specified dataset. If it is already loaded nothing happens. Returns the index of the loaded dataset.
        Returns:
        index of loaded dataset in this list or -1 if abborted by user
